titles: Englands Helicon Casta placent superis, pura cum veste venite, et manibus puris sumite fontis aquam.
author: Bodenham, John, fl. 1600, attrib. name.
N. L. (Nicholas Ling), fl. 1580-1607, attrib. name.
A. B., fl. 1600, attrib. name.
publisher: Printed by I. R[oberts] for Iohn Flasket, and are to be sold in Paules Church-yard, at the signe of the Beare,
notes: One of a series sponsored by John Bodenham, to whom the editorship is usually attributed; also sometimes attributed to Nicholas Ling and to A.B.

"To his loving kinde friend, Maister Iohn Bodenham" signed: A. B.; "To his very louing friends, M. Nicholas VVanton, and M. George Faucet" signed: A. B.; "To the reader, if indifferent" signed: L. N. [i.e. Nicholas Ling?--STC.].
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: English poetry --  Early modern, 1500-1700 --  Early works to 1800.
